results.title: The Dikes
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A dramatized presentation of the work of the Maritime Marshlands Reclamation Administration in the reclaiming of flooded agricultural regions along the Bay of Fundy. Through the account of a dike-keeper, the film describes the destruction that follows the breaking of long-neglected dikes during autumn rains and shows how M.M.R.A. engineers are cooperating with New Brunswick land-owners in the big task of keeping at bay the inundations of the sea.

results.title: The Digital Environment - Information about Australia's Culture and New Technologies
results.brief_description:
This CD provides an information resource about the intersection of new technologies and cultural activities including: web-publishing, copyright, interoperability, digitisation and other aspects of the Internet age.

Extensive video, reports, discussion papaers, glossaries and other material are available on the CD. There is a powerful index to search thense resources, and it contains hyperlinks to quickly access documents on the Web if your computer has an Internet connection.

results.title: The Digestive system
results.creator_credit: William Kay and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Animation, x-ray photography, and laboratory experiments show how the human digestive system breaks food down into substances which will provide energy for living. Examines the behaviour and function of each organ or structure involved in the digestive process.
results.description: Animation, x-ray photography, and laboratory experiments show how the human digestive system breaks food down into substances which will provide energy for living. Examines the behaviour and function of each organ or structure involved in the digestive process.

results.title: The Difference between us
results.creator_credit: Dan Klugherz and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: Shows the different practices of English and American secondary schools as shown in typical London and Chicago examples. In England there is segregation of students by ability, specialisation of courses and emphasis on passing external examinations, the school atmosphere generally formal and authoritarian, and with some social stratification of schools. In America students of all abilities are in the same classes, the supervision is relatively relaxed and permissive and social adjustment and development of individual personality is emphasised. There is much experiment and variation between schools, and some social discrimination particularly against African Americans.

results.title: The Difference
results.brief_description: Describes emergency treatment for excessive bleeding, failure in breathing, and cardiac arrest. Details the kind of first aid a non-professional can and should perform in case of an accident or emergency until professional help is available. Explains the needs of the bring and the consequences if the brains is denied oxygen for even a short amount of time.

results.title: The Diesel tractor
results.creator_credit: R. Lapresle, Denis Ward and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: Explains the principles of the operation of the diesel tractor and illustrates methods of service on the farm. The film compares the basic principles of operation of spark ignition and compression ignition engines; stresses the need for cleanliness in the transfer and storage of fuel; describes in detail the engine fuel system and how to service the injector and filter units; recommends the use of heavy duty detergent oils to reduce varnish formation on pistons.
results.creator_credit_for_label: R. Lapresle, Denis Ward and Technical and Scientific Films

results.title: The Diesel engine
results.brief_description: Old and new type fire syringe illustrates principles of compression, ignition and expansion. How it applies to the diesel engine. Operation and component parts of four-stroke cycle, double acting and opposed piston engines. Working of fuel injection systems.

results.title: The Die hard: the legend of Lasseter's lost gold reef
results.creator_credit: Supreme Films, David Crocker and Venture Films
results.brief_description: Reconstructs the story of Harold Lasseter’s prospecting expeditions in Western Australia and his later searches for the reef of gold he claimed to have seen in 1897, up to his death in the attempt in 1930.

results.title: The Diary of Mr. N: 1938-1967
results.brief_description:
This film opens in the late thirties with the love affair and marriage of Mr N, a munitions engineer, to Ilona, a secretary at his factory. Over the next thirty years we see their lives unfold, as this energetic and outwards-looking man records his work, his leisure, and the violent political upheavals of his country.

Like an epic novel, Mr N’s film diary has a huge cast of characters from all strata of society, a wide range of settings - both urban and rural, and every year or so, a new baby born to Ilona.

Mr N films prolifically and without self-consciousness, documenting what intrigues, interests and impresses him. His family survives the 1944 seige of Budapest by spending winter in an air raid shelter; in ‘53 he films several of his eight children marching in a May Day rally; in ‘56 a crowd destroying a statue of Stalin; in ‘67 Ilona lying on a deck chair, reading a glamour magazine. An incredible record of personal stability through traumatic times.

results.title: The Diary of Anne Frank
results.creator_credit: George Stevens and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A faithful screen translation of the Broadway play, based on the book, about the harrowing experiences of the Jewish Frank family and their friends when they are forced to hide from the Nazis in an Amsterdam factory for two years. Millie Perkins is visually perfect as the young Anne Frank whose spirit gives the group courage to continue when they lose hope.
